#Text=Zimbabwe opposition agrees to join government
#Text=Friday , January 30 , 2009
#Text=Flag of the Movement for Democratic Change .
#Text=President Mugabe will share control of Zimbabwe 's security forces under the agreement .
#Text=Image : Jeremy Lock .
#Text=Morgan Tsvangirai 's Movement for Democratic Change ( MDC ) has agreed to join a government of national unity in Zimbabwe .
#Text=Robert Mugabe will remain as president , while Tsvangirai is set to be sworn in as prime minister on February 11 .
#Text=Despite the agreement , Tsvangirai and other MDC members expressed disappointment over the terms of the unity government .
#Text=" We are not saying that this is a solution to the Zimbabwe crisis , " Tsvangirai told reporters .
#Text=" Instead , our participation signifies that we have chosen to continue the struggle for a democratic Zimbabwe in a new arena . "
#Text=Among the MDC 's concerns is the home affairs ministry , which oversees the police and security forces .
#Text=Under the power sharing agreement , Mugabe and Tsvangirai will share control of this ministry , and the MDC says Mugabe could use that power to quell dissent as he had in the past .
#Text=Tsvangirai signed the agreement to take part in a unity government at a Southern African Development Community ( SADC ) summit in Pretoria , South Africa .
#Text=Opposition leaders had been pressing Mugabe to relinquish control of the home affairs ministry and release imprisoned political activists as part of the power sharing deal .
#Text=But Tsvangirai 's party said they were pressured into accepting the deal by the SADC , who refused to condemn Mugabe .
#Text=Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga called on the SADC to stop " treating Mugabe with kid gloves " at the World Economic Forum in Davos , Switzerland .
#Text=" We hold the view that SADC could do more in trying to help the people of Zimbabwe resolve the crisis , " said Odinga .
#Text=" SADC should stand up and tell Mr. Mugabe enough is enough .

#Text=Meanwhile , Western countries such as the United States remained skeptical regarding the prospect of true power sharing .

#Text=U.S. State Department spokesman Robert Wood told reporters in Washington ,  If and when there is a government in place in Zimbabwe that reflects the will of the Zimbabwean people , the United States will then look to see what we can do to continue to help . "

column1: #Text=Mugabe claimed victory in a runoff election in June 2008 which was widely seen by the international community as flawed .

#Text=Earlier in March , Tsvangirai had garnered more votes than Mugabe in the general election , but the electoral commission said the opposition candidate did not receive a required majority of the votes .
#Text=Tsvangirai then dropped out of the June runoff , claiming his supporters had been attacked and intimidated by state officials .
#Text=Regional heads of government have been trying to negotiate a coalition government since the election .
#Text=Neither side had been able to come to an agreement over the distribution of cabinet posts .

#Text=Tsvangirai sought a constitutional amendment to recreate the post of Prime Minister , whilst Mugabe had wished to maintain his Zimbabwe African National Union – Patriotic Front ( ZANU-PF ) party 's hold on the main offices of state .

#Text=In the past year , Zimbabwe 's economy has gone into freefall , with inflation so high as to be effectively unmeasurable , and an outbreak of cholera that has resulted in over 60,000 cases reported and over 3,100 killed .
#Text=6.9 million people , more than half the country 's population , is in need of emergency food aid , according to the United Nations .
